text: Cox's Bazar-2 is a constituency represented in the Jatiya Sangsad (National Parliament) of Bangladesh since 2014 by Asheq Ullah Rafiq of the Awami League. == Boundaries == The constituency encompasses Kutubdia and Maheshkhali upazilas. == History == The constituency was created in 1984 from a Chittagong constituency when the former Chittagong District was split into two districts: Chittagong and Cox's Bazar. == Members of Parliament == {| class="wikitable" |- !colspan="2"|Election!!Member!!Party |- |style="background-color:" | | 1986 | Jahirul Islam | Jatiya Party |- |style="background-color:" | | 1991 |Md. Ishak | BAKSAL |- | |February 1996 |ATM Nurul Bashar Chowdhury |Bangladesh Nationalist Party |- | style="background-color:" | |June 1996 |Alamgir Mohammad Mahfuzullah Farid |Bangladesh Nationalist Party |- |style="background-color:" | | 2008 | A. H. M. Hamidur Rahman Azad | Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami |- |style="background-color:" | | 2014 | Asheq Ullah Rafiq | Awami League |- |} == Elections == === Elections in the 2010s === Asheq Ullah Rafiq was elected unopposed in the 2014 general election after opposition parties withdrew their candidacies in a boycott of the election. === Elections in the 2000s === === Elections in the 1990s === == References == ==External links== * Category:Parliamentary constituencies in Bangladesh Category:Cox's Bazar District
title: Cox's Bazar-2
